transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you can buy them, you can buy them in Dallas airport.

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, and you put them over normal sunglasses.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, can you make me a hundred copies of this?

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: (stares at Space Ghost from Moltar's monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Moltar) That the guy from Radiohead?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good. Moltar, we'll talk about it later. Hey! What's that? (walks over to a fancy projector-looking machine in the control room)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's a, uh... what is that? (Loud noise off camera) What!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking quietly to Moltar) Now you listen to me. I could go to jail in Mexico if Thom were to hear that I'm copying his CD. (glances over at Thom, who is watching them) Don't look at me! We're talkin' about dragons. (to Moltar) So you take Thom out to the set while I burn and verify these... (to Thom) these... dragons. (another loud noise as he releases Moltar)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You don't know how to work it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, I have a giant brain, that is able to reduce any complex machine into a simple yes or no answer.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, but that's not the CD burner...

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very very much, Space Ghost, for having me on your show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, sure... wanna, wanna see how this works? (he presses a button, the projector machine fires a brief ray, then falls over, explodes and catches fire.)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah! Welcome to the Moltar Show!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Thank you very much, Thom Yorke, for sitting next to the man! Of the century! Oh yeah!

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: You're very self-assured, you're very much a 90's man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (off screen) Come on! (off screen explosion; music stops; )

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That is fascinating! (music starts again) Thom Yorke, you are very very interesting, and very very perceptive!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So interesting and so perceptive that I think we will now fight with knives. (a large medieval looking knife pops into his hand; the music changes to a hard rock electric guitar beat)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies onto set) That thing wasn't a CD burner to begin with. (staring at Moltar holding a knife) What are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still doing DJ voice) I'm hosting the show!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat; knife is now gone. He resumes his DJ voice) Well hey, Thom asked me if he could see my knife, and Thom's doing a song about a knife, and he wanted to see what one looked like. Isn't that right, Thom? (knife reappears in his hand, followed by two guitar notes).

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause it sounds like a good idea. So do it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then I'll do it. (sings in low voice) I'm a kni-i-i-fe. Knifin' aro-o-o-und. Cut-cut-cut-cut-cut-cut-cut-cut-cut-cut... (walks back and forth on stage, making "cut" sounds)

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: Do you take those, those (motions with his hand)... intelligence drugs?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stops) I don't need intelligent drugs, Thom. Because I don't know what they are. Okay, Thom?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But I will put anything into my mouth that is given to me. Whether it's supposed to go there or not. (sits down at his desk) Because... I'm different.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where'd you learn to talk like that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What were you doing in Hattiesburg?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (from control room, in his DJ voice, with funky background music) Well, I happen to think that it's very very interesting!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, oh, and your wife's on the phone.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, just tell this woman that she's crazy. Just because I'm famous and sexy doesn't mean that someone can just go and marry me the second I leave the room.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, listen everybody... (stands up) please? Listen to me. I have a hit song about a knife... and yes, I'm married. And that is why I want you to hang up right now.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Moltar. (to his wife) Hey, honey, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sulphur? Sulphur's my favorite food, you know that. Is that why you called me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, not right now, honey, please, I'm, I'm right in the middle of a, um... giant space war.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: I, I enjoy talking to you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you do, but like I said, this space war, what can I do? Aliens.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (waving) Yeah, so, you have to go now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. So, I'll talk to you when there's peace. In space.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Yeah, and you like salmon or you like trout?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pounds his desk) You know what, it doesn't matter. Because I love you so much...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... that it's time for you to go to sleep.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because that's what it means to love a woman so much.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you believe what I'm telling you, right?

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: Shall I sing to you, or sing to -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, okay? Everything gets married. Even animals and spiders. And, just because they don't have cakes and suits and wedding parties and expensive rings, doesn't mean that they're not legally, ahem... married.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Doesn't seem like you love her.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, love is about compromises, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Compromising your future to the city council of Bethesda, Maryland. (beat) Cutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcutcut (scissor noise in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, marriage is about hiding in the kudzu behind your apartment, and not going in until the lights are completely out.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Your wife's on the phone again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, tell her I exploded, and tell her it was very sad, and the last thing I said was "make sure my wife moves out of my condo."

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: I have to go to the toilet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You remember the difference between the toilet and the sofa, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And remember how angry I got.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because that's what happens when you boil the cushions of the couch you'd been urinating on.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh oh, and, as long as I've got you here, (does his power band move) tell that French DJ Tricky to move out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't know, he's your damned friend.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: And I would love to introduce you to him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've met him. He's living on our couch, with the urine. And tell him to stop letting in strangers to listen to his new beats.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: It makes all the children happy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in low voice) Honey, those aren't children, they're packets of cream cheese.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: Sometimes I can't separate between the two, do you know that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. I.. wish I'd known that when we were just dating.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: You have a mask, has anyone told you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, honey? I buried a present for you out in the yard.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Why don't you go dig it up?

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: Kannski ... sleikja á þér tærnar stundum? (translation: Maybe ... lick your toes sometimes?)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah... well, I'll tell him you said that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, Zorak, it's just a bagel, she started calling "mother".

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: (motions with mug, as in making a toast) Here's to getting hitched, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (raises his mug) Yeah. Let's drink until our hearts stop.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Cool... well look, I've got a friend comin' by in about five minutes, so, uh... I gotta skate.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I think we're gonna smash lightbulbs out by the dumpster.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? I'm gonna go with you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well... (sighs) You can't. You're not my friend.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We have things in common. Er, your dad's still big into those trains, for instance?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well... what's he big into now?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Look, when my friend gets here, why don't you just go fly around or, hide or somethin'? I don't know, go to the kitchen.

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: You've got a, you've got a... (makes a circular motion around his nose and mouth)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: My friend's here, see you later!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (shouting) What did I just tell you earlier?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) Oh, sorry man. (ducks down behind his desk)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, your wife's on the phone again.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, do you get along with them?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sits up again) What, are you kidding, they're my best friends! That's why I married you, so I wouldn't have them anymore.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're welcome, I didn't. Hey honey, I really wanna go outside and smash glass with my mantis friend Zorak, okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, you know, he, he's my buddy from work?

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: Well, maybe you should stay indoors.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, I need this. For me. I feel like I'm in jail here!

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: I seem to, um, get the picture. If you know what I mean.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I know what you mean. (makes power band move) What exactly do you mean?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine, I will. And don't count on us ever getting married again.

transcript.speaker: Thom Yorke
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat, and holds up a black piece of yarn)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Your wife's on the phone again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you can just tell her that I'll be home no later than eight.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh. Look, honey, craziest thing, heh heh. Another space war, if you can believe that, and it's.. out by the.. dumpster, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hopefully this will mean peace. But there's someone here who would love to listen to your mouth.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get down here, Moltar. (to Björk) He wants to ask you every little thing you know about ice.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (walks toward Space Ghost's desk) No I don't.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you do. (aims his powerband, poised to fire)

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: I know quite a lot about things like that because I come from Iceland, which is a tiny place with only 280,000 people...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh... broke it all. I feel empty.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, here's some boxes. Let's break those down so that they'll store properly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't know from fun. This is responsible!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I need what you have. (quietly) I need a woman.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So that I can sell her organs to Black Sabbath.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to his phone) Space Ghost's chest phone.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: (over the phone) I have to say I'm a great fan of triangles.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have to say that I am a great fan of Chuck Norris, and he was in the Delta Force, and the delta was a triangle.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: The one that came up when I was eleven.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! You know honey, all this talk about Chuck is making me want to get married all over again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because at the Beta Barn, you get 20% off for each marriage.

transcript.speaker: Björk
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) And what's your name again?

transcript.speaker: Minister
transcript.dialogue: In sickness and in health, until death do you part?

transcript.speaker: Minister
transcript.dialogue: And do you, Space Ghost, take this woman...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (punches monitor, it flies out of view) Oh no. (pause)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (enters from off screen and punches Space Ghost, knocking him down. Moltar is standing next to him) Oh no!
